data.name: A Single Step (No longer in development)
data.detailed_description:
NOTE: This game is no longer in development. I got a job in the gameDev industry!

Scale a mysterious tower and brave the Early-Access placeholder textures with your friends!



A journey of a thousand miles begins with A Single Step.



Use your spear-thing as a weapon, boost, grapple, or reel!




Come ON, it's FREE! Support me if you want, but even if I starve you can at least download the game and give me feedback internally.
data.about_the_game:
NOTE: This game is no longer in development. I got a job in the gameDev industry!

Scale a mysterious tower and brave the Early-Access placeholder textures with your friends!



A journey of a thousand miles begins with A Single Step.



Use your spear-thing as a weapon, boost, grapple, or reel!




Come ON, it's FREE! Support me if you want, but even if I starve you can at least download the game and give me feedback internally.
data.short_description: A Minimalist Multiplayer Parkour game where players Dash, Swing, Wall-jump, Dip, Dive, and Swerve in a fully Procedurally-Generated low-Poly Parkour Playground! I haven't done the math, but there are probably like millions of maps or something. Oh, and invite your friends! And me. I can use friends.
data.reviews:
“Looks pretty good to me. You said it was free?”
4/5 – Some Random Guy

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7 or newer, 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-6100 / AMD FX-8350
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel Core i3-6100 / AMD FX-8350
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 100 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: These are very approximate estimates.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 7 or newer, 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4670K / AMD Ryzen 5 1500X
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 680 / AMD HD 7970
  • Storage: 101 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: These are very approximate estimates.

data.legal_notice: Please don't upload to the 'bay or anything. It's free. It's literally faster to send them a link. K?

release_date.date: never, sorry! This is a resume page now!
